SEARCH
Package abm

Class Agent

java.lang.Object
abm.Agent
Direct Known Subclasses:
Meteorite, Planet, Star
public class Agent extends Object
The Agent class is the base class for all objects of this simulation (stars, planets, and meteorites). It provides basic properties and functionalities common to all agents.

  • Constructor Details

    • Agent

      public Agent(double x, double y)
      This constructor initializes an Agent object with its initial position (X and Y coordinates).
      Parameters:
      x - The X coordinate.
      y - The Y coordinate.

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move()
      This function defines the movement behavior of the agent. Subclasses (Star, Planet, Meteorite) should override this function to implement their specific movement logic.

    • getX

      public double getX()
      This function returns the X coordinate of the agent's position.
      Returns:
      The X coordinate.

    • getY

      public double getY()
      This function returns the Y coordinate of the agent's position.
      Returns:
      The Y coordinate.

    • setShape

      public void setShape(javafx.scene.shape.Circle shape)
      This function sets the Circle object used for visual representation of the agent.
      Parameters:
      shape - The Circle object representing the agent.

    • getShape

      public javafx.scene.shape.Circle getShape()
      This function returns the Circle object used for visual representation of the agent.
      Returns:
      The Circle object representing the agent.

    • collide

      public boolean collide(Agent other)
      This function checks for collision between the current agent and another agent. It utilizes the 'getBoundsInParent' method of the Circle objects to check for intersection.
      Parameters:
      other - The other agent to check for collision with.
      Returns:
      True if there's a collision, False otherwise.

    • handleCollision

      public void handleCollision(Agent other, List<Agent> agentsToRemove)
      This function defines how the agent handles a collision with another agent. The default behavior is to remove the current agent if the other agent is a Meteorite. Subclasses override this function to implement collision handling logic.
      Parameters:
      other - The other agent involved in the collision.
      agentsToRemove - A list to add agents for removal during collision handling.
